diagnosis.final_diagnosis: autosomal recessive cutis laxa type 1B syndrome due to EFEMP2 mutation
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: Loeys-Dietz syndrome, Marfan syndrome, arterial tortuosity syndrome
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The presence of extensive arterial tortuosity, severe aortic dilation, and the patient's phenotype, including musculoskeletal features and family history, led to whole-exome sequencing which identified a known homozygous mutation of p.Glu57Lys in the EFEMP2 gene. This mutation is associated with cutis laxa type 1B syndrome and confirmed the diagnosis.
